intro: Adnaria incana, commonly known as the hairy adnaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. Adnaria incana is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to coastal environments.
